intro: Brachyscome glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular brachyscome, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically has hairy, glandular leaves that give it its scientific name. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Brachyscome glandulosa is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid regions.
